term.title: electrical arc

item.text: A self-sustaining electrical discharge between at least two electrodes, characterized by a comparatively small cathode fall voltage, a low burning voltage and a relatively high current density. The burning voltage of an arc is the voltage across the electrode gap during an arc discharge.

term.citation: Citation: 'electrical arc' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.E01918
